main event: An observer reported seeing one round, star-sized object appearing red and orange through a high-power telescope in Cincinnati on September 9, 1955.
interesting points: The sighting lasted for two hours., The object was seen as being stationary., The object was observed to be the brightness of a first magnitude star., The potential evaluation suggests it was Capella, a known astronomical object in the northeast sky., There is no photograph accompanying the report.
witness description: Civilian observer using a high-power telescope
